content: until you have 4 8 16 stitches remaining ○ you should be on a right side/outside row next 8 cut yarn from the front section and leave the front section stitches on dpns while working the back section 9 attach your yarn on the right side/outside of your back section the stitches saved on the circular knitting needles 10 on the right side/outside follow in pattern for all stitches 11 on the wrong side/inside follow in pattern for all stitches 12 repeat steps 11 and 12 until you have 12 16 16 total rounds ○ you should end on a wrong side/inside row 13 next round on the right side/outside work all stitches in pattern for the back section 14 when you reach your front section stitches add them in by continuing the k2p2 pattern for all front section stitches ○ the front section stitches might not be worked in pattern due to the decreasing and shaping of the front section don t worry just make sure to continue the k2p2 pattern around to make the top section seamless ○ when you re-add your front section stitches to the round you will have gapping at the two joining points i left these gaps and made sure to work the stitches around the gaps extra tight in the following rounds ○ the slight gapping allows the arm holes to have more stretch for a looser fit and easy movement 3 15 you ve now reconnected all your stitches from the front and back sections back into the round add a bor stitch marker at the end of your connection round 16 continue to work k2p2 for all stitches for 5 10 15 rounds 17 cast off all stitches using your favorite stretchy cast off ○ i used jenny s surprisingly stretchy cast off 18 weave in ends note this free pattern has been tested by the designer only feedback is welcome please email edits feedback and questions to outoftheloopsknitwear@gmail
